segments.text: I notice the boy is really stretching to reach those cookies, and the stool is wobbling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is just standing there, waiting for him to hand her one like it’s the most natural thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is completely unaware of what’s happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out of the sink, and she’s not doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm the girl looks, like she doesn’t even care about the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole kitchen is a mess, but the woman is just standing there, drying dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll ever notice the water or the children before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so nice, but inside, everything is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel like I should say something, but it’s not my place to interfere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is going to fall, and the girl is just going to stand there and watch.
segments.speaker: PAR
